title: Thank you to all the pool staff!
desc: It was good to be back and to see Bernard and Raymond at the pool as in all the previous years. It would not be the Shangri La without them. The team at the pool were very well organised and working hard. The fact that Raja remembered our name made us feel welcomed again after 3 long years of not being able to come. It was a pity that although we had requested a quiet room in the Valley wing, we were put next to a baby who cried every night. It did spoil our holidays somewhat.

title: Wish we could have stayed longer!
desc: Outstanding in all aspects, room in the Valley Wing. Every person we came in contact with was pleasant, helpful, and seemed to truly enjoy their job. Breakfast was excellent as was the afternoon canapés and cocktails. Enjoyed the spa facilities and the pool was excellent. Hotel was quite full as we were there just before Christmas. Really enjoyed the somewhat 'old school' feel to the Valley Wing. If we return to Singapore will definitely consider staying here again.

title: bad check-in experience (not late check-out)
desc: tried to check-in at the usual 3pm check-in but at 4.15 pm the interconnecting room still wasnt ready. at 345pm the room was still being cleaned seems Shangri-la service standard has dropped. the reason Im writing this is because i booked family staycation for my parents, nephew niece and my wife and daughter (4 adults 3 kids) in 1 regular room and 1 interconnecting room. and the kids and my elderly parents had to nap. so 7 of us were hanging around in the regular room. at first they only gave a late check-out ie extra 1 hour for only 1 room only later did they give extra 4 hours for all the rooms. i guess i can only check-in at 5pm....

title: Had some problems but ended up ok
desc: I stayed here for 2 nights, its a nice place but I did have some problems..check in took waaaaaay to long, guy was typing on the computer for a good 10 minutes. Then I went to my room n wanted a shaving kit, I waited over an hour n still didn't come, they stopped answering the phone so I had to go down to reception to collect it. I ordered some room service n I told them to bring it on a trolly and with a card machine so I could pay..the guy came with no card machine. I had some other small issues as people not using the bell to come inside, only knocking softly on the door which I could hardly hear & Laundry service also didn't follow simple instructions. Nevertheless it is a nice place, they have some good facilities and their room service food was good. I did enjoy my second

title: Luxury surprises!
desc: I know the concept of ‘staycation’ would eventually become secondary as many would travel abroad. But perhaps it was my first time in Shangrila Singapore, this staycation was extremely memorable. I have frequented Shangrila in Tainan and Taipei previously, but Singapore Shang was just another level. Service was simply immaculate and the experience was exceptional especially in the valley wing. Dim sum is a must try place in the shang palace. The stay was a remarkable one that provided great memories. The stay wad simply one that included multiple surprised beyond our expectations. Here’s highlighting some of the remarkable staff: - Jas the front office who helped me secured the reservation at shang palace and the perfect check in experience - Raja, Fabian, Sammy, Danish,

title: Excellent all round
desc: We held our management offsite here and am glad that we did so. The rooms were comfortable and spacious, service was good overall - including at the function room - and food was excellent. I would definitely return to this hotel for future stays.

title: Staycation over Christmas Weekend
desc: Instead of having an overseas holiday, we had decided to have a staycation at our favourite valley wing again. Well, we generally had a comfortable stay as usual and were happy to have good chat with some of the hotel friends like Aris, Edward, Zila, Wee Loong, Raja, Zac and Marvin. We were also delighted that lobby lounge bar which is now manned by a team of new comers Sammy, Danish, Shraddha and Mahesh had provided highly attentive and warm services during our stay. In addition, we were pleased that the quality of canapes served during the happy hours has improved considerably. The only negative experience would be the pool but the fault of the pool attendants. It was due to the selfish and inconsiderate hotel guests who had "choped" the sun loungers for long duration

title: A delightful stay
desc: The lobby is gorgeous, well-decorated with marble and greeneries. I booked a tower wing deluxe room via Amex FHR, but I did not get a room upgrade because the hotel is fully booked. However, the room is very spacious and the bed is really comfortable to sleep on. Breakfast buffet on the first floor is so-so.

title: Exhausted and no sign of rooms
desc: We have been waiting in the lobby for over two hours for our room. The hotel says 3 pm check in but it’s almost 5 pm and no sign. We are paying premium rates and have 3 bedrooms, yet we haven’t gotten a room yet which is ridiculous. I realise it’s holiday season but it’s not fair making us wait. With 2 small kids and all we have been offered is a welcome drink, it’s really not fair to make us spend so much, and make us wait and wait and wait. Just not happy.

title: Fantastic Christmas Stay
desc: We've had a fantastic 3-nights stay over the Christmas period. Would definitely come back & and recommend it to others. Here's our experience: As a young family of 3 with a two and a half years old toddler, we are always looking for comfort, children activities, convenient location & great food. Shangri-la ticked all the boxes & even exceeded our expectations. From the arrival until the check-out we've had the best time. The hotel was very busy due to the high season of Christmas but everything was always delivered smoothly by the staff. The check-in was done quite fast & our son received a lovely goodie bag. Huge attraction for the kids is the kids' club. It is one of the best we've ever seen anywhere in the world. From soft play area, to organised classes & activities,

title: December 26-31, 2022
desc: Amazing facilities especially for families with children. Hotel team was also most thoughtful and proactive. Would definitely be hard to top our stay there as the hotel felt cozy and relaxed even though we were there during one of the busiest times of the year. Very much worth the extra cost compared to other hotels in the Orchard area if you’re looking to spend more time in the hotel (swimming, health club, room, restaurants, etc.)

title: Stay experience marred by selfish act of pool’s sun loungers hogging
desc: Once again, spent our second Christmas with our most favourite local hotel, which also marked our 12th staycation since Shangri-La Singapore reopened for leisure stay in July 2020 during the Covid-19 pandemic﻿. Feeling joyful to celebrate Christmas with the ever friendly and warm-hearted people at Valley Wing namely Aris, Zac, Marvin, Edward, Raja, Zila, Peggy, Wee Loong and Calito. Pleasant to find a new team of dedicated staffs manning Champagne Bar. Sammy, Danish, Shraddha and Mahesh were always eager to serve and would never let our drinking glasses left empty. Though it was a busy time during Christmas, the service wasn’t compromised. This year’s Christmas also saw Christmas carolling at Tower Wing and Valley Wing, first time since the pandemic which really enhanced the

title: If I can, I will give more than 5 stars!
desc: We booked a Valley Wing Room for 3D2N over the weekend for our family of 4, 2 adults and 2 preschoolers. I have done so many staycations in the recent 2 to 3 years as we are unable to travel abroad during the pandemic. This has to be the best staycation and amazingly family-friendly. I cannot stop raving about how lovely and elegant the lobby was, when we arrived for check-in. Every staff member we meet, is friendly, helpful and attentive. I love how they treat my little girls and interact with them - it made us feel at ease! The log cake class for my older daughter was conducted so well, the Buds and Splash crew were welcoming and delightful. Our breakfast, afternoon tea and canapes were simply amazing. I wished I had remembered most of the staff members' names. But

title: Exceptional
desc: The shangri-la Singapore is a wonderful hotel with something for everyone. We could have easily spent a week in Singapore without leaving this hotel. The huge pool with sun lounges all around, the Splash pool for the children with waterslides and fountains, tennis courts, an on site bakery with beautiful coffee, plenty of space both under cover outside and inside the hotel in beautiful surroundings for that morning or afternoon or evening coffee or tea or something stronger. The turtle family to check on every day. The oh so comfy beds and the happy faces of all the staff. It's at the upper level of pricing but not by much, and so worth it. Also so close to orchard road and not far away from anything. We will definitely go back

title: Inner City Luxe
desc: I last visited this hotel about ten years ago. It's changed a bit, but not that much. Stayed in the garden wing, which personally I think is a must. New spa (I think) and a couple of new restaurants. Bar is great as was the buffet, but the highlight, as before, was a foot massage (two actually) beside the pool. Walking distance to the shops.

title: Our Days At The Shangri-La Singapore
desc: JGJM Our long stay experience at Shangri-La Singapore of 2 and half months so far has been Super! Staff are highly professional, pleasant, hospitable with personalized service and it feels like a second home away from home. The physical amenities of the hotel are excellent. Some exemplary staff I came across are Mr. Siva Sharmah Bell Captain, Ms. April Davis Duty Manager, Ms. Leeya Front Desk, Ms. Ashvinder Kaur Guest Relations, Ms. Jasmine, Ms. Gracy, Mr. Lawrence, & Mr. Wincy. Room Service Madam Bhargavi, Madam Fareeda, Ms. Jenny, Mr. Kavi, Mr. Kumar, Mr. Ramil & Mr. Rama. Concierge Desk - Mr. Raja Gopal, Mr. Rajiv, Mr. Hassan, Mr. Imran. All the Door Men, All the Bell Boys. Housekeeping Ms. Nora, Ms. Carolyn, Ms. Suleha, and Mr. Kiran. Honorable mentions Ms. Yana and Ms.

title: Classy hotel with outstanding service.
desc: Class hotel with outstanding service from the staff. We were in Horizon Club which was well worth the extra cost for the room. Hotel is well located just off Orchard Road. Room size was great and comfort and size of bed all good. Would definitely stay again if in Singapore.

title: Overrated and difficult
desc: Stayed in the family room in the tower wing and it was clean but too small for a family room. Impossible to get reservations at the restaurants. But somehow when I made a fuss, they could magically conjure up a table and when we went for dinner, the restaurant was quite! The Waterfall restaurant is fantastic, but the Line a la carte is awful (their breakfast buffet is good). A heads up that it gets busy on weekends would’ve helped instead of all the emails offering upgrades ahead of the stay. The pool and the kids areas were great. The hotel and info and room service menus that are accessible via a QR code are not up to date and the system is sketchy. You don’t quite know if it worked or not. I’ve stayed at other hotels that cater for kids needs that overall have much better

title: Careful with credit card transactions and express check out
desc: Was a lovely hotel, and the food and the service was great. Service except credit cards involved. I had an issues with my credit card that was on the booking and I had to provide a second credit card. Still my reservation was cancelled reason being credit card declined. But two days later the full amount was charged to My credit card that wasn’t worked in the first place. After contacting reservations, FO, hotel restored our booking. Ones we arrived, our room charges were already paid and we provided a credit card for extras. Mind you we had a pleasant stay, at the check out, I was convinced to express check out ( do not do that) after three or four days I still didn’t get an invoice on my email. I had to write to the hotel to double check that they over charged to my card.

title: superb hotel
desc: This place is just amazing. we have stayed at countless hotels and this one properly stands out. we were in the garden wing and it is genuinely stunning, like a rainforest in the hotel. being greeted by birdsong on our balcony in the morning was a real treat. from start to finish the staff were attentive, and friendly and could not do enough for us, including booking attractions and tables for us to sending more towels and helping with laundry. The entire team went above and beyond. now, the food. this hotel has the most wonderful food, Shang Palace of course being a standout. i urge anyone staying to try it. the buffet is quality and hot always, the Italian was really good and even the pool food was very nice the cleanliness of the hotel would be a gripe for me, paying the

title: Golden wedding
desc: We bookended our trip to Penang with our family with two three night stays. The first was in the Garden Wing with one daughter and her family, and the second was the two of us in the Valley Wing. It was so lovely. We had a wonderful time. The food was flawless and the level of comfort was exemplary. The jewel in the crown of our stay was the staff. As always, the staff are helpful, polite, efficient, and not intrusive. Our stay was memorable and we will treasure our time there.

title: Nice Location and Comfortable Setting
desc: Excellent location and nice hotel as always. Valley Wing was nice and they upgraded our room. Breakfast at Summit Room was top notch - well worth spending to get a room with lounge access at Valley Wing side, and have breakfast at Summit instead of The Line. We didn’t give 5 stars as sometimes service was not up to standard… it took over an hour to set up the room with extra bed and bed guards, they rang the bell at 10.30pm to deliver amenities (as it’s first day of Chinese new year so there was tangerines etc). The CNY set was impressive but it’s such a pain when you were with two young kids and trying to put them to sleep and door rang… but all in all, nothing major and we would still recommend this hotel to friends and families. Their CNY scavenger hunt was quite a nice touch

title: Fabulous hotel for a long or short stay.
desc: From the minute we were warmly greeted on arrival you knew this would be a great few days. The Horizon Club reception was efficient and thoughtful getting us into our room early after a 14.5 hour flight. The Room was stylish, well equipped with a lovely bathroom and a really comfortable king sized bed. House keeping was impeccable and done with a smile. TheClub lounge was smart with an excellent choice for breakfast and evening canapés. The staff were friendly, attentive, quickly learnt our names and were always smiling making you feel special. The interior of the hotel is stunning especially as it was celebrating Chinese New Year. Concierge gave excellent advice and helped us to make the best of some very bad weather. The Lobby Lounge was a good place for a drink or even a

title: Very comfortable bed
desc: This hotel is a great place to spend a few days, particularly for a family who love swimming in the pool. There are two excellent play areas for younger children as well - indoor and water-based. The Italian restaurant near the pool has really nice pizzas. Breakfast was ok, would be good to have a bit more choice of Western items such as pancakes/ crepes for example nutella or berries. It's great the breakfast stays open until 10:30am to accommodate jet-lagged people! Also would be great if the shuttle to Orchard Road was open also a bit later in the day - this is a great service but we are unable to use it. The gym had excellent showers available to use for people on late flights but who have checked out.

title: 5 stars throughout ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
desc: This hotel is grand, busy, welcoming and fabulous. It’s in a different part of Singapore to where we usually stay but easy walking distance to Orchard Road. We stayed in a Horizon Club room which was beautifully presented with all mod cons. The food & drink in the club was lovely. Loved the pool, especially the tanning deck! Service everywhere was exceptional. Great choice of places to eat within the hotel, a particular highlight was Shang Palace followed by exquisite cocktails at Origin Bar. Beautiful hotel, 5 stars throughout. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Love this hotel
desc: After visiting 7 years ago I always knew I wanted to return and it was as wonderful as I remembered. The pool loungers do get busy but the pool never felt overly crowded. I think the garden rooms are looking a bit tired but still beautiful. The pool view balcony was perfect for us and the hotel lovely and quiet at night. The breakfast is sensational and a highlight for my kids. My daughter really enjoyed splash. It’s the little things like the way the housekeeping arranged my daughters toys in the bed that make you realise what a special hotel it is. One thing I was sad not to see this time was the illuminated floating balls in the pool at night time. They were so beautiful! I definitely will be back 😊

title: Lovely Gardens at Shangri-la Singapore
desc: Beautifully appointed room in the Tower Section of various Shangri-la properties on this site. Especially impressed with the beautiful floral displays for CNY. Loved the outdoor gardens on the property, they were a welcome retreat from the noise of the city. Excellent service, yummy, creative dishes along with the city skyline views at the Horizon Club made our stay wonderful! Bell and Concierge staff with especially helpful.

title: loved this hotel
desc: such an amazing hotel. Our room was large and comfortable with a great balcony. Staff were super helpful and patient with us. The place was busy (and beautiful) but at breakfast, was a bit chaotic trying to move around to the various buffets checking out was available (and there was amazing variety).

title: Outstanding Staff Makes This a Great Hotel
desc: When one arrives at the Shangri-La Hotel, you know you’ve made the right choice for your hotel stay starting with the doormen who opens your vehicle door and greets you with such warm and friendliness. One such doorman is G. Kummar. He’s jovial and caring and is attentive to guests needs. You will find many of the hotel personnel are kind and attentive. I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a 5 star treatment but homey at the same time.

title: Oasis amongst the high rises
desc: The Shangri-La Singapore delivered everything and more! We were fortunate enough to stay on the opulent Valley Wing for 4 nights. From the moment we made our reservation everything was faultless. The hotel surrounded by beautiful gardens and a hop skip and a jump to Orchard Road was perfect - in a more residential area away from touristy Marina Bay. Breakfast was amazing plentiful and I wish I had a bigger stomach!! The Valley Wing offered free Champagne all day, afternoon tea and cocktails 10am to 10pm. The pool was huge amazing but sadly the spa want working. There are so many restaurants and cafes within the complex. Our room was huge and had every possible amenity you could possibly need. I loved the turn down service with sweet little boxes of macaroons and little treats

title: Very good stay
desc: Stayed here for 4 nights with family. The check in and check out were very efficient. We stayed in the garden wing and the room was large and well appointed. Stayed with family. The room service was slow and we received the wrong order one evening. One night I requested for a reservation for dinner at the waterfall restaurant. I was told the place is completely booked. However when I went down to the restaurant it was not as full and we were offered a table! This did not sit well with my family. The buffet breakfast named The line actually always had a line to it!! My kids really enjoyed splash. Overall we had a very good stay.

title: Good location , fair to the price
desc: We stayed here for 4 nights in the basic category room. The room was neat and clean. It’s located 2 mins away by walk from orchard road which is a big plus point. The check in and check out were very promptly handled . The hotel was busy throughout our stay. Didn’t come across very friendly staff members but all our requests were handled well. Getting a taxi from hotel lobby was a problem but I believe that’s all over singapore now. Overall, a nice pleasant stay but better service could have made our stay exceptional.

title: Outstanding!
desc: We stayed for the Christmas - New Year week with family. The hotel was at full capacity. Yet (and remarkably) not only all worked most professionally, but we continuously experienced proactive, warm, kind service and initiatives across all the facilities: swimming pool captained by Bernard, Splash for kids, the team at pool bar walking non-stops to serve customers, perfect Chinese experience at Shang Palace, great Italian food and service at Waterfall, courtesy and relax at lobby lounge , amazing order and sequencing at The Line despite so many people; here we experienced the team behind egg station, Mr Jaya Raj, Ms Lim Fong Moi positively and naturally conversing and engaging guests whilst preparing with an amazing energy given the amount of work and requirements: there were

title: 24 hour visit
desc: We stayed for one night in this hotel, once we arrived at 10.45am reception checked us in & we had our room. This was a lovely surprise as we were not expecting to get access to the room so early & was so nice to freshen up after a long flight. The room was a lovely size & had all the amenities that you need. Staff were so friendly. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to orchard road. It was raining, but great hotel had umbrellas in the room. We enjoyed our one night stay here but would definitely come back for a longer stay next time.

title: Upsetting service and declining standards
desc: I had a horrible experience this time staying at Shangri-La. I stayed more than 20 days on a business trip. 1. My personal item was missing in my room on Jan 20 , it was a stuffed animal but it was a very personal thing and i have no idea why it would have gone missing in my room. After I contacted the reception they checked with housekeeping that the item was taken away when they changed mu bedsheets. This is unimaginable given the item is 22cm long and cant be more visible. I am very worried if i will lose other valuables in my room, which is supposed to a safe private place. sent flowers and a generic apology letter, however they still didnt explain me where the item was and I am very concerned with the hygiene issue. 2. I tried to book a tennis court 2 weeks in advance

title: Wonderful
desc: Impressive hotel with all the meaning of the word. Service, amenities restaurants, helpfulness of employees you name it. Personally if the rooms were larger I’d of given it the hotel 5 stars. No doubt next time I’m in Singapore I will repeat at the Shangri-La for sure

title: Standard big hotel with great club lounge
desc: Booked this hotel stay with club lounge access under luxury escape stay over Christmas-new year period. Location: walking distance to Orchard Road. Hotel amenities: Has a big pool but also loads of people. Caters for family with children play ground. Eat: Club lounge has excellent evening canapé . But close at 8pm. VERY strict dress code: you would be told to change into proper footwear. Good place for breakfast with quality food served. Attentive staff. Main restaurant for breakfast: Big with good varieties. Serve yourself as the staff were too busy to give you individual attention. Room: Standard room with comfortable bed. Good toiletries. Value for money: I would consider other hotel for the same tariff.

title: Big family hotel that is perfect for business as well
desc: When I arrived I thought I had miss judged my choice of hotel for business because of the large number of families with young children.I was wrong ! It is large and professional to more than accommodate my business needs .The Club lounge ,Origin and Waterfall restaurants were excellent and plenty of meeting space in the lobby .By g thanks to all the staff especially Kumar at the front door who always got me a cab with good advice and travel plan

title: Amazing stay
desc: Afraid that I didn't catch names but wanted to say a big thank you to all the staff particularly on reception and the concierge who made our stay all the more special. Also the doorman who, tried contacting our arranged lift without success when it didn't turn up, but managed to find us a taxi, despite the fact that it was raining to get us to the port to join our ship. ''Thank you''.

title: Disappointing 3rd visit to the valley wing
desc: We were so looking forward to our 3rd visit to the valley wing, on arrival we were informed we were in the wrong wing which was the garden wing! We were very took aback when we were told we had been booked in there! This was despite me sending an email and receiving a reply a few weeks earlier! As you can imagine we were not impressed especially as Raja recognised us and came over to greet us! We produced our documents showing me were booked into the valley wing but not a great start! No being shown to the room no welcome back card no fruit,cake or bottle of wine like last previous visits as our anniversary had been remembered then without us informing them the 2nd visit! Room was lovely despite this and Raja made us feel welcome even if the hotel didn't! The breakfasts in the

title: Here is your utopia
desc: Understand the meaning of Shangri-La and I can assure the hotel live up to every bit the word says it is. Spanning over 3 wings, we started our stay at the Tower Wing - modern, inviting and fun (for the kids) , we were spoiled with the warm welcome and services; ammenities; and food. Travelling as a family with two little ones, we say a massive hallelujah when there is a splash pool, a kids club and adorable inclusion at meal time for the kids. We opted for a family room and we give plenty of kudos to Shangri-la on the innovative designs and arrangement to accomodate families and couples alike. When requires, a bay window sofas is easily turned into a safari tent bed for the little ones; or simply go back to a cosy window seat for the adults to enjoy the view outside. Our

title: Simply the best
desc: Stayed 2 nights on our travel around India & then 1 night prior to flying out of Deli airport From start to finish the staff could not do enough for us,every single one of them a true credit to the hotel . On our 1 night stay we upgraded to 19th floor with lounge access . It is by far the best hotel lounge we have ever been to the quality of food & drinks was so so good . All the staff members in the lounge was very professional & nothing was too much trouble & treated us like royalty . These staff members deserve mentioning as they all was so good Amit , Roma ,Anjali, Uzma , and Mamisa thank you for the great service you provided for us . This is the only hotel I will ever stay in when visiting New Delhi

title: Better options available.
desc: Ordinary. We booked this hotel months ago through an agent. We were promised a room upgrade and drinks on arrival. We received neither. I asked the gentleman at the counter whether these were noted on our booking and he said they were but the hotel was full. Judging by the numbers at breakfast and in other areas of the hotel this was not the case at all. Food was OK but extremely overpriced. Overall we enjoyed our stay but would not stay here again.

title: One of the best hotel in Singapore
desc: Booked a garden wing king room and upgraded to a valley wing room. Had a really pleasant stay with my family occupying all 3 parts of the hotel - the rooms are clean and service was impeccable. One of the best hotel in Singapore. Valley wing guests get to enjoy free breakfast across both restaurants (the line and summit lounge) as well as afternoon tea and evening e cocktail receptions. Sooo English!

title: Sumptuous
desc: Stayed several nights in January. Huge hotel with 3 main wings: we were in the Valley Wing, which has its own entrance /reception / breakfast area / terrace. The breakfasts there were excellent: a small room (the Summit) and a terrace outside. Recommend the Roti Prati. The staff attention and detail was super. Friendly, personal and know your name. Being in the Valley wing was good, as the main hotel reception is enormous - though immaculate and sumptuous - and the reception there we felt was a little too small/required a queue when we went; so the Valley concierge/reception was just right. Additionally Valley guests are provided with complimentary afternoon tea, (delightful particularly with a harpist plucking-away in the background) and I think, evening Cockails and canapes

title: Good food and staff
desc: We were last night to say goodbye to our friends , and seat at the lobby lounge. Great food and very friendly staff. I love to come back and tried other dining areas Recommend 👍 Also my friends stay for more than a week and love the service an time during the whole time. Good for families with small kids

title: Always Good
desc: Another enjoyable stay. Upgraded to a spacious luxurious Junior Suite. The staff at Horizon club provided friendly, efficient service particularly Zoe, Viola and Paul. Located within walking distance of Orchard Road, but a shuttle bus is provided. Very highly recommended.

title: Great Service - Origin Grill
desc: Has a celebratory birthday lunch for my staff at Origins today. Met Shelley again, a long time staff of SLS. She wore a well deserved suit, finally seeing her promoted. The Management have made the right decision and great that you treasure your staffs, instead of turning over frequently. She is fantastic as always.m an greeted me warmly. Rest of the staffs were great as well. Keep it up! - Dr C Ang

title: Short stay in Singapore
desc: Efficient service and well run operation. Despite the hotel being an older one as have stayed almost 15 years ago it is well maintained. Quite a pleasant short stay and the only small concern was we missed the cutoff for the breakfast at 10:32 and they were inflexible and said we could not have the breakfast that was to be included. Two minutes...All i wanted was a coffee and some bread.....it wasn't that big of a deal as we were on a complimentary voucher which we paid for at a Charity Silent Auction Event. Oh well ..business vs guest satisfaction. Hotels have to constantly make that choice

title: Shangri-la Singapore Definitely
desc: We have been staying here whenever we need to work in Singapore and are either too exhausted to trek back to Johor Bahru or the timings aren’t right. The Shangri-la has always been amazing and welcoming, the entire crew from front desk to dining, to housekeeping and facilities, also the Horizon Club peeps, thank you for the top-class service. We understand the pressure and demands guests can put on each of you. And so we thank you for always smiling and doing what you can to assist.

title: Perfect!!!
desc: We stayed at the Shangri-La Singapore , for one night. There is NOTHING negative to write about the hotel. The communication before our arrival were inviting, the staff from the bellman to the reception were very helpful. The room was very nice

title: Great start to a holiday
desc: We had 4 nights on the Horizon Club floor. Room was a good size with all the usual amenities you expect at this level The Horizon lounge exceeded expectations and staff were very attentive. The range and quality of the food provided at both the breakfast and evening buffets was very good. The only small downside is the location, not very convenient for public transport but there are always taxis. We would stay here again.

title: Big big thank you Shangri La hotel
desc: Great experience! Staff are so friendly , helpful and super supportive. Also Jega one of staff team is very helpful . No negatives to mention 😃 Room is clean , cozy and nice . Hotel overall luxurious

title: 6 days in Shangri-La
desc: A big hotel with Garden Wing, Tower Wing and Valley Wing. We stayed in Valley Wing. Separate entrance, some perks included daily afternoon tea and early evening cocktail hour. A la carte breakfast in Valley Wing very poor. No fresh juices at all, long waiting times for service, limited choices. Breakfast buffet in The Line extremely busy, as the hotel is huge and has 1400 rooms incl. residencial part. Nespresso machines usually didn’t work, quality of food 3 out of 5. Hotel rooms older, kept clean, L’Occitane toiletries. If you leave a luggage in a luggage room, make sure, they will not damage your bags ( can you imagine my Birkin travel bag under 2 cabins???). Nice evening in Origin Bar, good dinner in Shang Palace , but not really a Michelin star in terms of food. In Asia

title: Nice hotel, great location
desc: Lovely hotel with nice facilities. Restuarants for breakfast catered for all nationalities. Hotel is on orange grove which is around a ten minutes walk to orchard road. Nearest MTR is around 10 minutes walk once in orchard.

title: Best hotel in Singapore
desc: Stayed in the Valley wing Deluxe Room for a one night stopover. Outstanding service and hotel. The hotel grounds are wonderful along with the locality. We will come back as soon as we can for a longer stay.

title: world class property with terrific service
desc: This lovely property just felt perfect due to the spacious well appointed room with a pool view balcony, gracious and helpful staff and without equal an amazing breakfast buffet featuring food stations from around the globe. A special thank you to Mark at the concierge desk who went above expectations and helped me succeed in experiencing sunrise roof top yoga at the Marina Bay Sands. Open to the public it is well worth the early wake up call!

title: This is my Shangri-La ❤️
desc: This hotel make us all feel Royal. The level of service, cleanliness, room standards, and surroundings are impressive. Yes, it has a price, but for a business traveler like me it is well worth the money. My days are filled with stress and meetings, so having this oasis of wonderfulness available on off duty times, makes it truly my Shangri-La. Also the breakfast with its at least ten different cuisines if fit for kings ! The selection of food and fruits is astounding. There’s a chef at each station, specialized in his specific thing is seems, and they remember their guests impressively well. I just have to show my face nearby the “omelette chef” and he makes the exact omelette I like - every time ! The rooms have high standards, with the needed amenities, safe deposit box,

title: I was serve by Jega
desc: The employee was very good , polite and quick serve the guest well, when we need some information they help clearly..... Thankyou and salam from indonesia I will stay here again when im coming ti singapore

title: An oasis of serenity amidst the bustling city
desc: We needed a getaway from our hectic everyday routine without travelling far from home and shangri-la was a great option. Wasnt expecting much. But it was way beyond our expectation. The staff all around was great with elderly and kids. Love the ambience and there is so much activities to bond us together as family. Shout out to ashvindar, jega, soban, raj, dylan, gwen and all the buds staff, they make our stay truly a memorable experience for my family and kids. Love to see that their so passionate in their job amidst the hustle they went thru after pandemics. Will definately come back ❤️

title: A fabulous hotel.
desc: We stayed here for two nights as a stopover and could not have chosen better. This is a fabulous hotel. A warm welcome with bags instantly whisked to our room and a seamless check in. Just what was needed after a long flight. We had a room in the garden wing which was spacious and spotless clean with a view over the pool. The bathroom was lovely with a fabulous shower and had many quality accessories. Breakfast was plentiful with a full range of cuisines in offer. The quality of the food was also excellent. Special praise is reserved for the concierge team, especially Satish, who helped us out on several occasions. A busy hotel but doesn’t forget the personal touch. We really enjoyed our short stay.

title: Excellent, just a few issues….
desc: Stayed here for 10 nights, the hotel is beautiful, the food at breakfast was good, but extremely disorganised and is reminiscent of a zoo. There were people just stacking their plates and tables full of food, then leaving it, it was such a waste and resulted in shortages for everyone else. By 09:30 breakfast wasn’t being replenished and therefore we were left with cold leftovers that were left in the serving bowls. The pool was nice, especially the guys with the towels and those serving the drinks, however, again a few people spoiled things, the jacuzzi said no children, however, it was full of children whilst parents just left them to splash everyone. Again none of this is the hotels fault. Unfortunately there had been rain one day, and unfortunately due to the slippery steps

title: Enjoyable stay
desc: Booked a horizon club room and Check-in was fast and seamless. Room had a nice view. Also the bed was very comfortable Food at shang palace was excellent Interactions with staff generally very pleasant Gian at lounge was always asking if I needed anything , and made me a mocktail despite the lounge not having any, Ella recommended me some tea Lobby interaction with Hakim was nice and Jaya Raj at Line was also very friendly Massive gym with plenty of equipment and nice, huge, swimming pool Also noticed staff at health spa hard at work , frequently cleaning/disinfecting the gym equipment Huge variety of breakfast at the Line, although it was more quantity than quality. Although the lounge breakfast had quite a different array of food and of higher quality. Will

title: Fantastic gem of a hotel though a little far out
desc: A superb hotel, cannot fault the staff, the service nor the amenities. Everything was thought of and provided. Had a club room and the breakfast was delicious and the canapes outstanding. Only tiny drawback was that the corridor outside the bedroom wasn't as quiet as it could be, you could hear trolleys being wheeled along. I would have still given five stars but for us, as it was our first time in Singapore, the hotel location wasn't ideal as we had to get a cab everywhere. Usually we like walking round a city more. Grab cars made it easy and cheaper than the normal taxis but annoying to need them.

title: Wonderful Experience
desc: We had a wonderful experience at the Shangri-La in Singapore. Starting from our arrival at the hotel, we arrived at 9am in the morning and were offered a complimentary early check in and a room upgrade as this was part of our our honeymoon trip. We really appreciated this as we had just come off a 13 hour flight. The staff at this hotel are extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast offered a variety of different cuisines and the pool area was perfect to just relax and take a swim. The hotel is located in a very nice area (Orchard) and everything is walking distance: supermarket, money exchange, shopping mall (ion Orchard) which is connected to the underground system. There are plenty of restaurants on Orchard Road for lunch and dinner, you can also get food in the Mall food

title: Too many young children
desc: Booked via an agent have stayed in the London Shangri-la which was perfect so was expecting the same experience- but sadly no on r first evening arrival early evening felt sure as we were staying in the hotel there would no problem getting a table for dinner but sadly NO all restaurants full! Extremely disappointed as unaware of the local area dident feel we wanted To explore tied and hungry the waterfall restaurant took pity on us an “allowed” us to eat in the waiting area outside! It windy but tolerable just until a unattended little girl just kept wondering around in and out of the restaurant banging the door goodness Noe’s what the inside dinners throught but I was appalled the staff did nothing running around the pools edge ruined my meal I was concerned for her

title: Lovely hotel shame about the food
desc: We stayed for 3 nights in the Tower wing The room was luxurious, spacious, everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel Breakfast was chaotic with machine coffee, a large buffet and generally not a pleasant experience We dined in the Shang Palace restaurant, it was classed as fine dining, we were bitterly disappointed The food was served on cold plates, the sauces were congealed and in general tasteless We complained and were given a reduction in our bill but it didn’t really compensate for how awful it was

title: Memorable Family Staycation
desc: Had a very happy and memorable experience @ Shangri-La for birthday staycation and celebration. All the employees are amazingly helpful and friendly. Excellent service! A special thanks to Jega for his help.

title: Mr. Soban from the front desk the best hotelier
desc: I frequently patronise Shangri-la for business lunches and celebratory meals. A familiar face on the lobby floor is Mr Soban. Extremely knowledgable and helpful. He will always have a smile on his face and serve guests the best way he can. I brought my mother for a meal there yesterday and he was very warm and welcoming. He even took the time to chat with my mother while we were waiting to be seated. Definitely worth going to Shangri-la for their hospitality and general awesome-ness. Nice, clean, neat and private. Shangri-la is one of the best.

title: One of the best hotels in Singapore
desc: Booked 2 rooms for 2 nights for a staycation with my family (4 adults + 1 infant). All of us had a good night sleep, the beds were so comfortable in-fact one the best hotel beds in Singapore. Hotel is kids-friendly, great for family with children. Hotel also gave lots of free gifts for my son! The breakfast buffet is delicious! There are no negative things to say about the hotel and the stay. The hotel staff were so helpful and friendly, would also like to compliment G.Kumar (doorman) for his excellent service. We would love to come back again in the near future (if there’s discounts and promotions hehe ;) )

title: Amazing Hospitality and Kids Friendly!!
desc: We are family of four together with other three families stayed here for business and leisure. Just like other our Shangri La stay, i can't find any flaw. The staff were great in their task and managing guests. Started with Leeya whose very attentive in arranging our room. We arrived early and requested for early check-in as we have kids with us. We managed to get the room and she even gave goodies to our kids. They were happiest in the world. Every morning breakfast we were served the best omelette by Jaya Raj. He already knew my ingrediants selection for omelette during our second day of stay. Our kids completed their quest for treasure hunt by meeting two of the very gentleman, Benjie and Kumar. They explained about the hotel and Mongolia warrior, the kids amazed with that.

title: Inconsistent staff
desc: Staff members were highly inconsistent. G. Kumar at the Concierge was great for making the wait at the cabs seem bearable. But Gladys at the reception is not a problem solver. Requested for a late check-out (by 30 mins to an hour - just in case i’m late from my meeting) and she said she’ll have to enable late check-out for the entire cohort which had around 20 delegates; of which some would have departed. There is something wrong with the existing policy, especially for group bookings and stays if the negotiation has to apply to all delegates.

title: Less than impressed no upgrade even though hotel not full
desc: I am a gold status with hotels.com and this is a vip access hotel which guarantees a free upgrade when available. Didn’t happen and each day I would repeatedly go to front desk to be told no. Then advised can only get upgraded to next level which has never been the case before ie often upgraded two or more levels or more. Room very average with a weird layout bed on the diagonal. Service Ho hum. At $500 per night there are so many other better options in singapore. Location not great either CANT step out to shopping, mrt or other hotels. The line all day restaurant apalling. No atmosphere and a big barn with sub quality food. Needless to say I won’t be back

title: A holiday well spent
desc: I had the privilege to stay at the Shangri La Singapore’s Valley Wing during my last visit to Singapore. The experience was second to none. From the moment you enter the hotel through dedicated a VIP-style entrance, you are greeted by an outstanding team of butlers escorting you to the reception. What makes the Valley Wing outstanding is the level of personalisation it offers to customers. Kudos to butler Raja from the Lobby Lounge for always going the extra-mile in making sure everything went smoothly during afternoon tea and evening cocktails. Raja surely is a great brand ambassador for Shangri-La. French cheese selection at the evening cocktail time is succulent. Yoghurt selection at breakfast is to be commended too. Rooms are very spacious with the classic feel you would

title: Disappointing effort
desc: Pre pandemic I have been a regular user of Shangri-La hotels. As usual I stayed in a Horizon Club room. Was it me but I felt the helpful, friendly, welcoming atmosphere has disappeared. No restaurant open after 9.00pm, staff looking at watches when you arrive close to last order time. Not everyone wants to have room service at that time. Staff refusing to refer requests to speak to the duty manager and then referring an account enquiry to Head Office. Disappointing.

title: perfect service, friendly people as always - and one lousy experience
desc: Everything as usual: Perfect service, very friendly staff, all my needs even before I arrived were taken care of. Staying at the Valley Wing for 25 years, it is remarkable to see that many members of the staff are still there. Yet, this time, all the good things - for which I pay a considerable premium vs other five-star-hotels in Singapore - are being overshadowed by something that I was confronted with already last time, but this time again. Upon checking in, the hotel wants your credit card. Now I am a European citizen but do have local cards for various countries, so I said that I wanted to use my Singaporean DEBIT card for payment. They came up with a big arguement why that was not possible and first insisted on my European CREDIT Card. Now I learned my lesson from my

title: Over crowded
desc: We are currently staying at the Shangri-La for 11 nights in a Valley Wing room , it is so crowded with families,it’s a long weekend and there are so many children in the “ lounge “ running around screaming the atmosphere is kind of like a kindergarten but with booze,it’s pretty horrible .Towards the end of the night most of the staff who work 12 hours a day 6 days a week are exhausted and they just want to go home.We usually take a suite at the Intercontinental and the lounge there is excellent we shall certainly stay there next time, don’t get me wrong the Shangri-La is good just not good enough.We have 3 more nights here, more whisky stat !

title: Memorable to say the least…
desc: My stay was nothing short of perfect, From the warm welcome and the friendly professional attitude of the staff that made me feel right at home from the first moment, To the amazing room that has everything needed to make my stay pleasantly memorable…. Cozy and luxurious thrown into the mix to provide mere perfection. And the breakfast at the Lime, can’t believe the diversity of food I have seen there! I have been to many hotels all over the world and never have I seen this collection of morning cuisines in one place, exquisitely delicious too. Thank you Shangri-La team for the best couple of days I had in a long time.

title: DO NOT expect much
desc: If the experience was to be with a 3 star hotel, it would of been a "good" experience. The challenge at this "valley wing", 5 star facility and the premiere wing of the resort, it was disappointing. The people were good, the service staff were always friendly and helpful but the facilities itself requires love and servicing. The hardware is now old and leaky, from showerheads to leaking rainforest heads above. While the tub was leaking and due to mildew, is less than ideal. The change of rooms were no better with similar challenges. No upgrades were offered, and the invoice for washing of the clothes that got wet were waived upon "request" at checkout. Unfortunately disappointing for our children's first vacation, and our anniversary.

title: A Beautiful Place
desc: Very pleasant staycation! Front staff were very warm and welcoming. Serving from their heart. This hotel has a soul! Breakfast at The Line was a good start to the day. Quality food with a great variety. Staff at the pool and kids Splash were friendly and vigilant. Everything exceeded expectation. Long live Shangri-La!

title: The saying you get what you pay for does not apply here
desc: I don’t believe this hotel is 5 star, nor worthy of its $500 a night price tag. Expect to wait a lot, for check in, for a porter, for a taxi, for breakfast, to enter buds, food etc waiting waiting waiting. I found some of the staff at front desk and around the hotel to be unfriendly. There are some that are fine but the service is not what you would expect. I watched a staff member enter and close the lift door on me and my family. The hotel itself is beautiful - but so are many hotels in Singapore. The breakfast is overcrowded and you wait for a table, then your rushed to your table where you battle with other guests to get breakfast. Lots of kids running around everywhere. I think they need a better system set up for breakfast. Buds is an awesome facility with a

title: Nice looking hotel but not a pleasant stay as staff are unfriendly and incompetent
desc: PROS: Good spread at Club lounge Good staff at club lounge Good shower Besides the club lounge and nice premises, nothing else good about this hotel CONS: Uncomfortable bed Good breakfast spread but SLOW to top up, many empty dishes, staff were all over the place, seems to have lack of staff overall. The restaurant Mgr also seen picking up plates. Basic room Unfriendly staff which is surprising for a hotel of this price and so called stature Restaurant management during breakfast was terrible - caused an argument because the staff couldn’t monitor who came first and someone cut the queue because you could just enter the restaurant from the back. There are empty tables outside by the pool but the line for breakfast isn’t handled well or fast. In room dining food was bad.

title: Exceptional Employees
desc: Traveling alone to a country you've never been too can be daunting-- especially as a woman. However from the moment I arrived, I was welcomed and very well looked out for. One of the front door attendants named Jega, was extraordinarily kind to me-- took the time to learn my name the first day and continued to look out for me everyday-- making sure if I needed anything I knew he was there. And he was always there-- for help with taxis, my luggage, getting some water, and just asking how my day went! While the hotel is what you would hope to expect from a 5 star hotel, it is the people they employ that make the trip extra memorable.

title: Comfortable stay but dated
desc: We spent 5 nights at the Shangri-La in April. Overall we enjoyed our stay, it was comfortable, the staff were good (especially bell boys and concierge), we absolutely loved Singapore and crammed lots into our short visit.. I have to say though, this isn't a 5 star hotel and probably needs to be regraded to 3 or 4 star until it's undergone refurbishment. Initial impressions and the lobby/reception area were lovely, but our room (deluxe king in the tower block) was very dated and in need of a refurb, with a view out over a scruffy rooftop. The pool area was tired. Breakfast was OK, no special gluten free options which was disappointing as I'd read TA reviews suggesting there was, it was busy and chaotic, self service coffee via a machine, none of which I'd associate with a 5

title: Luxury Retreat Now a Kids Holiday Camp
desc: Raucous children everywhere! Last orders for all food & drinks is 9:30pm, except for a very limited room service menu. A superb luxury retreat in the city has been downgraded with a large kids club “Buds”, pirate water park, playground, a frenetic pool area and overpriced buffets. I’ve stayed many times over 40 years, but service standards have sadly slipped, & the hotel now essentially functions as a noisy holiday camp for young children. The exception is the Shang Palace, which still works to maintain a quality experience.

title: Stunning hotel.
desc: Stunning hotel. A bit of a walk, 10 mins to the subway for the amazing modern underground. Far nicer and more modern than London, Rome, New York! Staff were wonderful. We had a late flight at 23.00, so on our last day, we left our luggage to do another day of exploring and then used the spa facilities to shower as a later check out wasn’t possible. There were 5 showers in the men’s spa. Outdoor pool phenomenal. Massive and had a good deep section. Room was excellent, very modern with usb sockets. Great views. Architecture and design of hotel was great. Breakfast a good experience, with lots of good Western choices for us. I would stay here again! Beautiful.

title: Horizon Club
desc: We stayed in a deluxe Horizon Club double room number 2230 on the 22nd floor in the Tower Wing. The room was adequate without being luxurious. The safe didn’t work when we checked in & despite asking for it to be fixed it wasn’t by the time we left. The highlight was the Horizon Club on the 24th floor where we were superbly looked after mainly by Viola & Paul who were both from Manila, they went above & beyond to look after us. There’s nothing to complain about apart from the safe issue. It’s a bit out from the centre but that didn’t give us a problem. Singapore is very expensive if you’re a tourist so beware of food & drink prices in bars, hotels & restaurants. Thank you Viola & Paul as you made our stay a delight with you smiles & welcomes.

title: Exquisite service @Shang Palace
desc: Celebrating birthdays @Shang Palace. Led by Rebecca, Micky and wing were always on point with exquisite service. They remembered what I liked and were seuperbly attentive and very cheerful. Food was spectacular as always! That’s why I love coming back. Thank u for making our soecial day really memorable.

title: awesome
desc: very friendly staff and excellent service and facilities. kitchenette very handy with family with kids. prime location................................................................................

title: 3 Ms; Most Memorable Moments
desc: Most memorable Moments and Everlasting Experience in my life on my birthday. I was awed, pampered and greeted with few pleasant surprises be it birthday gifts or wishes, celebrations and tender loving care (TLC). Specially mention and applaud the following staff for thoughtfully and making that special arrangements and moments making me feel welcome, satisfied, happy and the list goes on. They are : Front Office Manager : Joan Seng Guest Services Manager : Swaran Muru Horizon Club Lounge Manager : Zoe Ang Horizon Club Lounge Staff : Qureisha, Putri, Sheryl, Eileen, Paul, Gian, Ella, Gary, Lydia, Chloe, Ricco and Jonas. Also Chef Vincent and Chef Alex. Director of Reservations : Poh Gek Customer Service : Leo I am sure I will be back and strongly recommend for any events, stay

title: Luxury at its finest.
desc: Luxury at its finest. Everything was perfect: check in , check out, food, service, pool and service at the pool, Shang Palace Chinese restaurant. Rooms impeccably clean and very comfortable Everything you would expect and more from a luxury hotel. Food and drink was to a high quality and always perfectly prepared and tasty . Service, nothing was too much trouble. We were made to feel welcome and appreciated everyones kindness. Will definitely stay again in the future. Great choice for international travellers.

title: Fantastic family holiday!
desc: Shangri-La really amazed us. It was a beautiful hotel in a stunning location. The greenery and nature garden surroundings really have the hotel a 5* feel. The buffet breakfast was vast in choice even for us vegetarians- there was something for everyone with cuisines from all around the world. Kids loved the swimming pool and the splash by buds area which was free to use but the indoor play area was paid. Plenty of sun beds. The staff were very friendly and really went out of their way especially for the children. They were greeted with goodie bags and as we were celebrating a 40th birthday and anniversary a lovely gesture of cake and decor was awaiting us in room. We had the tower wing room and a sofa bed was made up for our son. There was a lot of activities going on around

title: Spent quality time with family
desc: spent my quality times with both my kids and family. We enjoyed buds and splash (playground and pool) whole day in the hotel. Best hotel I ever stayed in Singapore. The staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Horizon Club Deluxe room and lounge access
desc: I am a big fan of the Shangri-La brand of hotels and always excited to visit a new property. I was pleased to say that I really enjoyed my time here in Singapore. We prefer the Horizon Club rooms with access to the lounge. It is always a great space for guests and the Singapore lounge is on the highest floor of the property. My one negative for Singapore was the shuttle bus times and service. It ran mid morning to mid afternoon so not particularly convenient or useful. Public transport can be reached on foot. This is a large property and worth exploring when there. Breakfast can be very busy but there is a sumptuous array of foods to enjoy and guests in the Horizon Club may prefer the more limited but quieter lounge. The pool and pool area are lovely and you can easily

title: Commendation for Exceptional Staff Member and Feedback on Breakfast Experience
desc: I would like to commend an exceptional staff member, Frances, through this letter. During my recent two-day stay at your hotel, I had multiple interactions with her, and she displayed an extraordinary level of thoughtfulness, kindness, flexibility, and genuine concern for guests' well-being. However, I would like to bring up an issue that occurred during both mornings of my stay. On both occasions, the breakfast staff asked for my room number multiple times. Sometimes, right after one staff member asked, another would immediately approach me to inquire about my room number. This repeated questioning was slightly inconvenient and somewhat disruptive to my breakfast experience. While this issue may seem minor, I wanted to provide this feedback for your consideration. I believe

title: Mixed Bag
desc: Stayed here for a week in the Garden Wing. The room was large and well furnished. Strangely, though, there is no proper fridge, just a compressor-less chiller that does very little to keep things cool. On the other hand, the air con was not only noisy, it chilled well below the set temperature. Even setting the thermostat to 28 degrees resulted in a freezing room temperature. A mechanic made some adjustments, basically no effect. Beds were noisy when one turned over, which was apparently due to a lack of caster cups under the beds (so their rubber wheels moved and made noise). A boxspring was broken. And a curtain motor switch did not work. These things were all addressed, but they should not have been there to begin with. Disappointing was the lack of service recovery.

title: Great hotel close to Orchard Road.
desc: Great hotel Shangri-La is always a good experience Beautiful grounds for the heart of Singapore. Perfect location and quality rooms. Waterfall Restaurant is top notch. Thanks again for a great stay.

title: A very nice hotel
desc: An excellent greeting on arrival. Bags whisked away and escorted to Reception. Big cool lobby area very busy but feeling of peace. Check in and room available even though it was still early morning. Were in Garden Wing which would recommend as nice views from balcony. Managed to catch a late breakfast. Vast area but amazing choice and never seemed to run short. 15 minute to walk to Metro although there was a hotel shuttle and taxis were plentiful and reasonable. Pool area was a delight after the heat and bustle of the day. Always plenty of seating available. All staff were excellent. Hotel Bar Origins was also a very nice relaxing area to sit and have a drink. If in Singapore would definitely recommend the Shangri La.

title: World Class Customer Service
desc: Great location, spacious and inviting lobby, modern facilities and excellent customer service. The standard of service in the Horizon lounge in particular is one of the best in my experience. Similarly, even the in-room dining is a very pleasant experience. The staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. I can’t praise them enough and I plan to stay here every time I visit Singapore.

title: Very best service ever!
desc: Stayed in the Garden Wing. The surrounding of that particular building gave me very nice, relaxing and homely feeling despite I was on a business trip. Very decent service by pleasant and caring people with smiles. Also, there was a touching surprise from the hotel which was a birthday cake for my mum who accompanied with me. It definitely made our day! I'd like to appreciate again and hopefully, I can go back soonish.

title: Superb service - particular thanks to JEGA the Doorman !!
desc: Overall we just had a superb experience at Shangri-La Singapore. Travelling with our 2 daughters aged 4 & 5yrs old all our needs were more than catered for from the wonderful staff at this historic and impressive iconic property in Singapore. Check in manager was super and flexible to ensure we had the right room type. Housekeeping did a consistently good job and big thanks to WINNIE from the Housekeeping Team-who was really friendly and fun with the kids - they appreciated their gifts at the end of our stay. Also look out for the hero that is JEGA - top job, main doorman at the hotel. Totally on point, focussed and always one step ahead. He had an attention to detail, incredible memory and such a warming and personable character. He looked after our kids and made sure we had

title: Auntie New at breakfast made my stay.
desc: I wish to write my heartfelt gratitude to the excellent service from Auntie New @ breakfast this morning. Auntie New's warm and sincere smile and friendly tone temporarily transported me to alternative reality where I felt I was not a paying guest, but I was sat at my grandmother's table almost as if her and I were family. Never have I met such a sincerely warm and wonderful yet astute and professional individual in any service setting, ever. I wish her all the very best; Auntie New made my stay and that's why I give the hotel 5 stars. BB - former UK diplomat.

title: Good experience
desc: Tuiling, Lance and Maggie are very nice and we had a very good experience in Shang Palace to celebrate our 1st anniversary. They even prepare a special cake for us. We tried two different set menu and mostly are seafood. Second time here in Shang Palace. Highly recommend

title: Very good hotel
desc: Another successful stay at the hotel . A special thanks the staff in the valley wing who always take such good care of us . If I have one complaint it’s the children running around and being noisy in the valley wing lounge . The day of the week in the lift was a instant reminder of how unique this hotel is .Sadly gone .

title: Our Yearly staycay at Shang❤️
desc: Joanne the guest relations lead at Valley Wing was very friendly, accommodating, and efficient. Michelle the Valley Wing Manager was sweet sending us a bottle of red wine on our last night~ so thoughtful! The team in the lounge is definitely receptive to your needs and Chi Spa as always is awesome making this stay a memorable one! Special mention to Karen, Angie, and Emma- our receptionist and therapist.

title: THE BEST !
desc: We had a very very sad experience during our stay in the hotel. ALL people in the hotel helped us excellent . The General manager Mr Rice was always next to us. Everybody was discreet and very empathic. We have got everything we need- your help was great!! Thank you very much. If possible we would give you 1000 stars!!! We recommend this hotel to everyone !who is visiting Singapore 🇸🇬

title: G KUMAR is the best at ShangriLa Singapore
desc: The rooms are clean and spacious, the pool is amazing, the service from staff has been outstanding with a special mention of G KUMAR who was the most friendliest and helpful staff member from the first time he greeted us at the door. Highly recommend this hotel..

title: Kids friendly hotel
desc: Friendly staff and young kids friendly hotel with outdoor water theme park, treasure hunt, indoor playground and breakfast with broad variety - Judy room keeper generosity My kids enjoyed a lot Location wise if walk to town will be 15 minutes walking

title: Elegance is truly a standard at the Shangri-La Hotel.
desc: The Shangri-La Hotel is quite simply elegant and a beautiful hotel. Its staff are diligent in everything they do, making every guest feel special and well cared for. From check-in to its many quality restaurants to its spacious but efficient rooms, the Shangri-La invokes the classic hotels of the past, with the efficiency and quality of elegance demanded by business travelers today. I enjoyed my stay, and look forward to visiting again. Traveling CEO.

title: A little help goes a long way
desc: Thanks Dylan & Lawrence for your assistance. You both were incredibly welcoming and helpful. Made my visit to buds a pleasant one. The food was delicious and good ambience.. I would definitely come back! Stay safe gentlemen. 🫶🏻

title: Very good for families - a few suggestions too!
desc: We stayed for two nights in a Garden Wing, Pool View Room. We visited as a couple with a young toddler. Prior to our visit I had enquired about suitable room types for a cot and was told this was the best room option. Unfortunately this meant that the family ‘packages’ and the additional amenities for families in the Tower Wing were not available to us so we were washing up bottles in the bathroom sink etc. The room we had was spacious but did have a balcony so from a safety perspective we chose to always keep the door closed. The bath was great with a toddler - very generous! Our toddler has a number of allergies which posed a problem at breakfast. The only bread options that were both dairy and soy free were small crusty rolls which are not suitable for a toddler with few

title: Beautiful garden hotel in Singapore
desc: This is a great hotel in Singapore. The room was very nice, and the service is incredible throughout the hotel. The grounds of the hotel are like a botanical garden, and the pool is a real treat. The breakfast brunch is very nice (almost a bit overwhelming in terms of the variety that is available!). The lobby has a great expansive feel to it. In terms of drawbacks, there are two to consider. One, it is definitely a hotel that caters to families with younger children. I think it is great, but I understand some people may prefer a quieter place. Second, it is not so easy to walk from the hotel to say Orchard Street. The streets just around the hotel are not so pedestrian friendly, so most people take cabs to get in and out of the hotel. But overall a really great hotel!

title: An excellent stay. Great proactive Service Recovery at Checkin
desc: Spent 1 night in the Garden Wing on a staycation over the May Day long weekend. Guests at the Garden Wing checkin with the guests from the Tower Wing. This resulted in a chaotic main lobby Because it was also a public holiday weekend. People were trying to check out, others trying to checkin and many others waiting for their rooms to be ready. As expected, our room wasn't ready even though we arrived closer to 4pm. But kudos to the hotel, they GROs did a great job by patiently explaining the situation and spreading us around the lobby area so there was no scrum at the counter. The hotel gave us a day pass to enjoy the pool while waiting for the room to be ready. They also extended a drink voucher which was good for coffee (Nespresso), tea, or juice (think concentrate). 45 mins

title: Wonderful hotel, first class service.
desc: Wonderful hotel, first class service. We stayed as a family of 5 for one night on the way to Europe and were treated like royalty. Met by name as we got out of the transfer minivan from Changi that the hotel organised and taken straight to our connecting rooms. Gifts for all three kids and rooms made up with the a sofa bed for three. Spotless rooms, comfy beds, luxurious bathrooms in the Garden Wing. Service around the pool was stunning as was breakfast. 15 minute easy walk to Orchard Road. Truly a first class experience and couldn’t recommend more highly.

title: Unmissable
desc: Exceptional hotel. Great facilities for children and adults. Very central for quick access to Singapores attractions. The highlight was Ravi Kumar and his colleague's service at the pool bar each lunch time.

title: A true 5 Star
desc: World’s most child friendly hotel. Singapore has many attractions for a child and Shangri-la Singapore, should be advertised as one of them. My child loved the amenities. From, splash to buds she would spend hours. Special mention to the staff, courteous and helpful. It’s them who make this hotel a 5 star facility. Lobby staff is beyond real. Outstanding and keep it up.

title: Luxurious and Friendly
desc: Luxurious and Friendly This stay was so amazing. The staff are wonderful and the whole experience has been a highlight of our holiday so far. The food and drink are next level and we’ll worth spoiling yourself Plus you cannot forget the special rooms. A totally unforgettable experience. Thank you Shanghai-La

title: Service at its best!
desc: We stayed at the Shangri-La for 4 nights this June for my sons birthday. The hotel is well located at Orchard Grove road just minutes from the malls and the MRT. The lobby, pool and grounds are absolutely stunning… the flowers, the sculptures and bric a brac make the large almost overwhelming spaces cosy and relatable. We stayed in The Valley wing which epitomised the quite luxury and opulence that the Shangri la is known for. The rooms were spacious and well appointed and the bathrooms huge. I loved the little touches such as the macarons placed on our bedside every night. What touched us the most however was that unbidden the hotel placed a cake in my Sons bedroom the morning of his birthday. He was thrilled!! The one thing that jarred was the all day cafe. The

title: "Exemplary Service and Unforgettable Experience
desc: Jason at The Line buffet, Shangri-La Singapore, provided exceptional service that made my dining experience truly memorable. His warm demeanor and in-depth knowledge of the diverse cuisine impressed me. Jason's attentive care ensured that my needs were met without being intrusive. He displayed a genuine passion for his work, offering insightful recommendations.

title: Disappointing services
desc: I am currently staying at Shangri la with family and friends and had booked this hotel thinking of it to be kid friendly but to our dissatisfaction the hotel is lagging behind in services as the house keeping, in room dining and basic services are really very slow. Writing this review after staying for two nights already and four more to go. Yesterday we called in room dining to get kids food heated and the in room dining arrived after four phone calls and 2 hours after the first call . Can it be called kid friendly?? Also called for baby milk which was earlier billed for an exhorbitant amount which is generally complimentary in resorts world over and later given with a warning that baby milk is not complementary and will be charged. Today again called house keeping and they

title: Simply a wonderful experience
desc: Being our first visit to the wonderful Singapore, i wanted a hotel that would provide a good experience for me and the family,,and boy did the Shangri-La deliver. The whole experience was simply amazing,,from the check in lady who greated us to our room to every personal in the hotel. Its a resort within the city. Special mention to Chef Ara Sayegh who despite the dinner buffet being packed yet personally made sure that we are well taken care off and gave us a special treat also. Excellent work chef Ara and keep up the good work. My only regret is that i have to leave this wonderful place but would definitely be back as soon as possible. Thanks for completing our wonderful experience in lovely Singapore.

title: Wonderful service by Dylan
desc: Dylan promoted line buffet to me and my friends. A very professional and friendly staff. Wonderful to have met him. explained to us the use and how to access the app. A definite asset to company. Good customer service skills

title: Spontaneous trip.
desc: Met up with a friend from Dubai and stayed at this amazing hotel. Everything about it was outstanding….location, rooms, dining, and all of the staff were so friendly and knowledgeable. Would recommend to anyone who wants a luxury hotel in Singapore.

title: Thank you Dylan!
desc: Was having coffee at shophouse with my friends, Dylan came and introduce us shangri-la membership with great discount to dine in the line, very nice and cheerful person with great customer service

title: Valley Wing is the best!
desc: Great hotel, as always. The Valley Wing with the superb staff makes you feel at home. Spa and gym also great. Location a bit away from the business centre I prefer. Easy access with taxi everywhere. Good restaurants in the hotel, but close enough to good alternatives.

title: Excellent service at Buds and Splash!
desc: The best part of our stay is my daughter's experience ar Buds and Splash. The facilities and equipment quality are excellent, the staff are helpful and friendly with kids. I'd like to give the best credit to one of the staff ar Buds- Mr Chenzhi, thank you for your extra care and attention provided to my daughter. She had a great time playing at Buds and with him.

title: Beautiful stay!
desc: This hotel is beautiful. The lobby is stunning . We had a room on a high floor which gave us, great views of the city. Food was great; including room service and the club lounge; the manger of the club lounge ( i have forgotten her name) was outstanding. So lovely. We had a blip on our first night where we were given the wrong room key but the manager on duty immediately and graciously resolved the issue. The hotel is not far away from orchard road, the main shopping district, but i enjoyed being away from the crowd. It's a great hotel!

title: Excellent hotel in Singapore
desc: Truly excellent hotel - our fourth time staying here and our longest. We love Singapore and this hotel. The hotel staff make you feel valued and nothing is too much trouble for them. The food and Spas are excellent too.

title: Employees with the right attitude, Service above self!
desc: Mr Sivanesan, Mr Agilan, Mr G Kumar Ms Jasmine and Ms Hazel was of utmost assistance with our stay making it very comfortable and convenient with great service attitude ever ready to be heared and respond. It felt like Shangri-La has cracked the code in developing highly empowered all star employees.

title: Great place to stay
desc: From checking in to checking out and everything else in between at all times staff were attentive, helpful and polite. Room spacious, clean and amenities really good. Beautiful surroundings around the pool area, breakfast choices catered for everyone. Excellent location for walking to Orchard Road and / or railway station. Definitely recommend

title: Sensational service at Shangri-La
desc: First time in Singapore and glad we stayed at the Shangri-La. Excellent rooms and facilities, loved the pool! Front desk customer service is by far the best I’ve experienced. Kimi was super helpful and did everything to accommodate our requests. Thank you Kimi! Definitely worth staying here, convenient location next to shopping malls only a walk away. Staff are super friendly. Thank you Shangri-La for making our stay enjoyable.

title: 5 Starrrrr
desc: Food and ambience was great at Waterfall. Awesome service by: Andreano, Simone, Gwen, Loges & Nash was awesome. Thank you so much for your hospitality and taking care of us. Will definitely be back! Front office, bell desk and Swaran was awesome too.

title: Beautiful Hotel
desc: My husband and I had a brief overnight stay at the Shangri-la hotel Singapore. The hotel was beautiful. The staff were professional, friendly and most attentive. The rooms were clean and spacious. The breakfast was fantastic, with lots of options to choose from. The hotels location is only a short stroll from Orchard Road. Will definitely be back the next time we're in Singapore, and would recommend it to other travelers.

title: Shangri-la by name, Shangri-la by nature
desc: For forty years we have been guests of the Shangri-la hotel. In that time we have seen the Garden Wing and the Valley Wing built without detracting from the beautiful tropical ambience. And while the number of rooms has grown, the amenities remain of the highest quality while the staff continue to exude the Shang culture of excellence and caring for the needs of their guests. Whenever we are in Singapore the Shang will always be our home away from home.

title: The Best Service You Can Get ShangriLa Singapore
desc: This is the 2nd time we are here at ShangriLa. Why we are here again? They have the best rooms, facilities and of course services.We are here for 3 nights and 4 days. One staff that has been super frenly and helpful is Jega. For the last 2 days he took the time to talk and entertain my daughter and has been super polite. He knows the best places to go for good food. We will definitely come back here again of coz because of the spacious rooms.

title: Thank you dylan
desc: I was in Sharilla today and I met Dylan in the lobby, he was very friendly, professional and gave lots of information about membership, thanks Dylan for his hard work, continue to deliver the good job

title: Wonderful stayca!
desc: Excellent service from all service staff and comfy bed. Spacious room and Buds program was awesome. The down side - Got to work on the pillow and quilt had a bit of smell. Maybe to replace those bedding with new ones.

title: 5 star accommodation
desc: Shangri-La is such an amazing place to stay! The rooms were clean and well designed, the facilities like the pool and restaurants were awesome and the service is impeccable. When I had left my phone in a taxi the concierge tracked down the taxi and retrieved my phone, delivered up to my room within the hour. The front taxi organisers are such nice people, especially Kuman!
